fact_check_explanation_title: South Korean police don’t use purple dye cannons on protesters
fact_check_explanation_summary: Dye in cannons is a widely used but controversial policing tactic around the world.

fact_check_explanation_title: Facebook post about Italy, coronavirus and 5G is almost all false
fact_check_explanation_summary: The post wrongly claims Italian doctors have found Covid-19 is caused by a bacteria.

fact_check_explanation_title: Keir Starmer led the CPS when it did not charge Jimmy Savile, but he wasn’t the reviewing lawyer
fact_check_explanation_summary: Keir Starmer was Director of Public Prosecutions when it was decided there was insufficient evidence to charge Savile, but he was not the reviewing lawyer on the case.

fact_check_explanation_title: Covid-19 is the underlying cause of death for most people who die with it
fact_check_explanation_summary: ONS data suggests Covid-19 is the underlying cause of death for 94% of people who die with it.

fact_check_explanation_title: Alcohol-based hand sanitiser cannot catch fire, without a spark, just because it's in a hot car
fact_check_explanation_summary: Hand sanitiser can only ignite at temperatures found in a hot car if there is a spark.

fact_check_explanation_title: Footballers aren’t banned from wearing the poppy
fact_check_explanation_summary: The poppy has always been allowed in the Premier League. It was banned in international fixtures but this ban has been lifted.

fact_check_explanation_title: More people have probably been killed by coronavirus than were killed during the Blitz
fact_check_explanation_summary: An image being shared online is a fair reflection of what we know about the death tolls from Covid-19 and the Blitz.

fact_check_explanation_title: Does any country have 'a functioning track and trace app'?
fact_check_explanation_summary: Boris Johnson claimed no country currently has a functioning Covid-19 track and trace app.

fact_check_explanation_title: This honeycomb pattern was made by bees, but it was no accident
fact_check_explanation_summary: The picture was originally attributed to bees at a National Trust property, but actually seems to come from a beekeeper who partly curated the pattern.

fact_check_explanation_title: Police have not warned the public about face masks doused in chemicals
fact_check_explanation_summary: Viral Facebook posts falsely claim criminals are handing out face masks doused in chemicals that cause unconsciousness so they can rob houses.

fact_check_explanation_title: Many French care workers will get a tax-free bonus of up to £1,340 for working during the pandemic
fact_check_explanation_summary: Those in the most heavily affected areas will get up to £1,340 and the rest will get up to £890.

fact_check_explanation_title: Black Lives Matter Scotland say they did not produce “Kill a White On Sight” stickers
fact_check_explanation_summary: The group have said they do not support the message of the stickers.
